quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Word and Meaning
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, mean, funkify. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The song Ole Man River from Showboat was written for a notorious basso. Although not in the original production, this basso came on board for the revival in 1932. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Robeson

questions.question: What is the meaning of estivation?

options.text: the act of building a nest
the art of creating new words to represent entire sentences, or shorthand notation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: going somewhere for the summer

questions.question: What is the meaning of the world kalling?

options.text: a headache which covers the entire head
the use of foul or abusive language to relieve stress or ease pain
fortunetelling based on what variety of cabbage a blindfolded person picks

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fortunetelling based on what variety of cabbage a blindfolded person picks

questions.question: What is the definition of the word buccula?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a double chin

questions.question: Which of these is the meaning of the word quodlibertarian?

options.text: a pedantic person who engages in elaborate arguments about minor things
someone who either has been married four times or who is married to four people
a person who will testify to anything for the right price
one who can talk about numerous subjects

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a pedantic person who engages in elaborate arguments about minor things

questions.question: What does a tegestologist do?

options.text: predicts the movement of stellar objects
collects beer mugs and beer coasters
studies porcelain and items made of porcelain
trades with old coins and notes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: collects beer mugs and beer coasters

questions.question: What does the word hoxter mean?

options.text: the inside pocket on a suit or coat
one who advocates equal rights for men

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the inside pocket on a suit or coat

questions.question: Which of these is the definition for the word funkify?

options.text: to cause a frog or a toad to fly through the air
to quickly eat ones meal, not taking time to savor it
to spend all your time trying to make money

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to run away in fear

questions.question: What was the name of the riverboat in the Kern/Hammerstein musical, Showboat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cotton Blossom

questions.question: What step is defined as a solo tap dance with sharp foot accents, springs, leg flings, and heel clicks.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buck and wing

questions.question: Sammy Davis, Jr. was a great tap dancer, actor, singer, comic actor, and a member of the Rat Pack.  What was the name of the act that led to his fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Will Mastin Trio

questions.question: What does the word hadeharia refer to?

options.text: the practice of constantly using the word hell in speaking
the crime of beating a person in their own home

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the practice of constantly using the word hell in speaking

questions.question: What does the word tarantism mean?

options.text: the act of eating raw flesh
an urge to overcome melancholy by dancing
tyrannical rulership of a woman by her husband

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: an urge to overcome melancholy by dancing

questions.question: What was the name of Laurie Williams creepy farm-hand stalker in Oklahoma!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jud Fry

questions.question: Tomecide is a word referring to which of the following?

options.text: the philosophy that society is built upon individuals helping each other
a neurosis caused by serving in the military
a place with few or no men

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: murdering or destroying a book

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Mother and South Pacific
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, raoul, emile. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the mother of the nine muses in Greek mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mnemosyne

questions.question: Is Maia the mother of Dionysus, the Greek god of wine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Who is the mother of the Greek god Hephaestus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hera

questions.question: Which cat sings Memory in the Andrew Lloyd Weber hit musical, Cats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grizabella

questions.question: Who composed the music for West Side Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonard Bernstein

questions.question: Which of the following actors was not a performer in the original Broadway production of Hair?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matthew Broderick

questions.question: What was unusual about Luther Billiss performance of Honey Bun in South Pacific?

options.text: He performed it in both Act 1 and Act 2.
He performed it in the shower.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He performed it in drag.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, is Semele the mother of Hermes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Where do Christine and Raoul sing their love duet, All I Ask of You in The Phantom of the Opera?

options.text: On stage during a performance of Il Muto
In box 5 during a performance of Il Muto
On the roof of the Paris Opera House
On the grand staircase of the Paris Opera House

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the roof of the Paris Opera House

questions.question: In South Pacific what circumstance of Emile de Becque at first repulsed naive nurse, Nellie Forbush and threatened their Enchanted love for one another.

options.text: He was a secret Nazi sympathizer.
He had two inter-racial children from a former marriage.
He cultivated his plantation using slave labor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had two inter-racial children from a former marriage.

questions.question: Does the Greek goddess of love, Aphrodite, have a mother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The musical Miss Saigon is based on what classical opera?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madame Butterfly

questions.question: I Enjoy Being a Girl is from what Broadway musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flower Drum Song

questions.question: In Wicked Elfaba puts a spell on the monkeys enabling them to fly. Why did she cast the spell which earned her the loyalty of the monkeys?

options.text: To save them from the approaching tornado
To save them from the lions
To save them from the clutches of the Wizard
To save them from Glenda who had them caged as pets

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To save them from the clutches of the Wizard

questions.question: Who was the mother of Zeus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhea

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Werewolf and Werewolves
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, lycaon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the mother of Athena, the goddess of wisdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metis

questions.question: What accident turns Jack Nicholsons character into a werewolf in the 1994 horror movie Wolf?

options.text: He is bitten by a wolf.
He almost drowns and is saved by a wolf.
He finds a cursed statue and takes it home.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is bitten by a wolf.

questions.question: What metal are werewolves afraid of according to modern legends and stories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver

questions.question: People suffering from this mental disorder believe they are able to turn into wolves or werewolves, or any other animal form.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clinical lycanthropy

questions.question: What 1995 film, directed by Carlos Saura, features performances by Paco de Lucía, Joaquín Cortés and Manolo Sanlúcar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flamenco

questions.question: In this passionate and dramatic dance, the man plays the part of a matador and the lady usually represents his cape.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paso Doble

questions.question: What method of turning a werewolf back into a normal human being was practiced during the Middle Ages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Abrazo, ocho, caminada and giro are terms typically associated with this dance that originated in South America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argentinian tango

questions.question: The term lesbian is derived from the name of a Greek island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: According to legends, a human can initiate their transformation into a werewolf if they drink rainwater from this source.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wolfs footprint

questions.question: What type of people turn into werewolves according to Scandinavian mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old women

questions.question: According to Greek mythology, Lycaon, king of Arcadia, was turned into a werewolf-like creature because he served Zeus a dish of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lycaons child

questions.question: The first legends about werewolves originated on this continent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Europe

questions.question: What does the wolf-like creature called nahual steal from people according to Mexican legends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheese

questions.question: What physical characteristic was used in the past as an indicator that a werewolf is in their human form?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Dance and Works
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, pink, dances. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these works was not painted by Claude Monet?

options.text: The Woman in the Green Dress
Bridge over a Pond of Water Lilies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Luncheon on the Grass

questions.question: In the late 19th century a group of impressionists, writers and art lovers centered around Edouard Manet, gathered at this site in Paris for discussions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Café Guerbois

questions.question: What dance style, that evolved in the 1970s in New York City, involves moves known as Toprock and Downrock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breakdance

questions.question: Pas de basque, pas de chat, pas de deux are terms related to ballet. What does the French word pas mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: step

questions.question: Who of the following was not an impressionist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean-Léon Gérôme

questions.question: Which country is not correctly paired with its national dance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil - Salsa

questions.question: This French impressionist, whose most famous works were The Pink Dress and Family Reunion, died in the Franco-Prussian War when he was only 29 years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frédéric Bazille

questions.question: Who recorded the Academy Award-winning song to which Baby and Johnny performed their final dance in the 1987 movie Dirty Dancing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Medley and Jennifer Warnes

questions.question: Which of the International Ballroom dances is possibly named after a 1930s Mickey Mouse cartoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jive

questions.question: Who was the British artist, born in 1839 in France, who painted Street in Moret and Sand Heaps?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Sisley

questions.question: Who was known as the Father of Impressionism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Camille Pissarro

questions.question: Impressionism took its name from a painting by this artist called Impression, Sunrise.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Claude Monet

questions.question: In the time line of art history impressionism was part of which period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Modern art

questions.question: The classical tutu, worn by ballerinas, is featured in this French artists ballet paintings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Degas

questions.question: Which Latin dance is not performed in International Style Ballroom competitions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merengue

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Helen and Troy
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, face. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Some legends state that Helen of Troy’s mother was Nemesis and she threw the egg from which Helen was born. Who did Helen share this egg with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dioscuri

questions.question: Helen of Troy was called The Face Who Launched a Thousand Ships as she inherited a huge fleet from her father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The name of Helen of Troy is derived from the Greek word meaning sun.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Ska music was born in Jamaica in the 1960s. Which of these names appears very often in ska lyrics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudy

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the siblings of Helen of Troy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asclepius

questions.question: Which hardcore dance involves people jumping around and pushing each other in a circle in front of the stage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moshing

questions.question: Which one of these is the name of Helen of Troys daughter from Menelaus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hermione

questions.question: Was Helen of Troy immortal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: At the 2000 Roskilde festival nine people died while crowd-surfing at the concert of which band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Jam

questions.question: What is the name of the act of getting on the stage during a concert and then jumping in the crowd below?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stage diving

questions.question: What American impressionist painted the works Tea, The Boating Party, and Summertime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Cassatt

questions.question: This artist, who hated the term impressionist and insisted on being called realist, was famous for painting ballet dancers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Degas

questions.question: What does the most popular hardcore dancing move, two step look like?

options.text: Placing one foot in front of the other and jumping on it with your arm thrust opposite to the leg that is moving in the front
Jumping around and swinging your fists, stomping back and froth across the pit
Spinning karate kicks in a sequence
Punching the floor and stomping in place, throwing your fists back, trying to strike anyone behind you

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Placing one foot in front of the other and jumping on it with your arm thrust opposite to the leg that is moving in the front

questions.question: Which New York hardcore punk band did parody hardcore dancing in their music video Step Down?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sick of it All

questions.question: The most common hardcore move two step was taken from which dance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skanking

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackfoot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meshuggah

questions.question: What major language is one of the official languages in New Zealand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English

questions.question: In what country is the Slavey language spoken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: Which of these mythological figures is not one of the Titanides?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Selene

questions.question: Which is the American metal band, whose frontman Mark Hunter is often called Metal Moses, because on concerts, he often parted the crowd in two parts, just like Moses did at the Red Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chimaira

questions.question: What is the name of the act of pretending to play the guitar with your hands and moving your body as if you are following the rhythm of the music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air guitar

questions.question: On what continent is the Urdu language spoken?
